1.brief: elevation, i.e. the act (literally, a journey to a higher place, figuratively, a thought arising), or (concretely) the condition (literally, a step or grademark, figuratively, a superiority of station); specifically a climactic progression (in certain Psalms)
David, the youngest son of Jesse
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

2.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

3.brief: alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy
to glow or grow warm; figuratively (usually) to blaze up, of anger, zeal, jealousy
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire

4.brief: water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to gush; by implication, to inundate, cleanse; by analogy, to gallop, conquer
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

5.brief: to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

6.brief: to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
something torn, i.e. a fragment, e.g. a fresh leaf, prey, food
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff

7.brief: properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks
a (metallic) sheet (as pounded thin); also a spring net (as spread out like a lamina)
a (metallic) sheet (as pounded thin); also a spring net (as spread out like a lamina)
properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks

8.brief: an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
